territory.deleteWarning:
Territory "{{code}}" and all its maps and assignments will be permanently deleted.
You cannot undo this.
territory.resetWarning:
All address statuses in territory "{{code}}" will be reset to their default state.
You cannot undo this.
territory.codeExample: Territory code. For eg, M01, W12, etc.
territory.nameExample: Name of the territory. For eg, 801-810, Woodlands Drive.
territory.noTerritoriesDescription: Create a new territory to get started.

map.mapTypeInfo: Select whether this is a multi-story or single-story map.
map.coordinatesInfo: Latitude and Longitude of the map. This is used for direction purposes.
map.multiStoryDescription: This map will include multiple floors, each containing several units. The map is designed to organize and display units across different floors efficiently.
map.singleStoryDescription: This is a map with a list of single-story properties
map.sequenceExplanation: Enter house or unit numbers separated by commas. For example: 1A, 1B, 2A or 301, 303, 305. The system will create addresses in the order you enter them.
map.dragToReorder: Drag and drop the cards to reorder the sequence

address.name: Name
address.coordinatesDescription: Latitude and Longitude of the address.
address.deletePropertyWarning:
Property "{{number}}" will be permanently deleted from "{{name}}".
You cannot undo this.
address.deleteFloorWarning:
Floor {{floor}} and all its units will be permanently deleted from "{{name}}".
You cannot undo this.
address.notesInformation: Property notes only. No personal information.
address.resetWarning:
All property statuses in "{{name}}" will be reset to their default state.
You cannot undo this.
address.deleteWarning:
Map "{{name}}" will be permanently deleted.
You cannot undo this.

congregation.duplicateSequences: Duplicate option sequences found. Please check your input.
congregation.deleteOptionsWarning:
Options [{{options}}] will be removed from the dropdown.
Existing records will use the default option instead.
You cannot undo this.
congregation.minimumOneOption: There must be at least one option in the dropdown list.
congregation.optionCodeTooltip: This code will appear in the territory house boxes. It will be used to indicate the type of household.
congregation.optionDescTooltip: Description will appear in the household dropdown list.
congregation.optionSeqTooltip: This determines the positioning of the option in the dropdown list. Dropdown is sorted in ascending order.
congregation.optionCountableTooltip: This determines if the option will be counted in the territory completion percentage.
congregation.optionDefaultTooltip: This determines the default household type of a congregation territory. Default option will not appear in the territory house boxes.
congregation.expiryDescription: The duration of the territory slip link before it expires
congregation.triesDescription: The number of times to try not at homes before considering it done
congregation.duplicateOptionCodes: Duplicate option codes found. Please check your input.
congregation.dragEditHint: Drag rows or use arrow buttons to reorder. Click fields to edit.

theme.description: Choose your preferred theme or follow your system settings

boundary.title: Something went wrong

guide.subtitle: Let's get your congregation set up in 5 easy steps

step1.title: Create Options
step1.what: Define labels to identify different household types
step1.why: Publishers use these labels to tag households they encounter.

step2.title: Create Territory
step2.what: Set up geographic regions to organize your ministry area
step2.why: Territories help divide large areas into smaller, manageable sections. Each territory will contain multiple maps.
step2.example: Examples: Downtown, North District, Block A1-A5, Zone 3

step3.title: Select Territory
step3.where: Select Territory dropdown menu at the top
step3.what: Pick which territory you want to add maps to
step3.why: Maps must belong to a territory. Selecting a territory first tells the system where to place your new maps.

step4.title: Create Maps
step4.where: Create Map button (after selecting a territory)
step4.what: Add specific buildings or addresses to your selected territory
step4.why: Maps are the actual locations publishers will visit. Each map contains individual households that can be tracked and updated.
step4.example: Examples: 123 Main St, Apartment Complex B, Shopping Mall, 456 Oak Avenue
step4.selectTerritory: Select a territory from the dropdown above to continue

step5.title: Assign Maps
step5.where: [Assign] or [Personal] buttons on each map card
step5.what: Generate shareable links to give publishers access to maps
step5.why: Publishers use these links to view maps on their devices, mark household statuses, and update household types in real-time.
step5.info: After creating maps, use the [Personal] and [Assign] buttons on each map to share with publishers.
